text: Edward Calvert Nixon (May 3, 1930 - February 27, 2019) was an American entrepreneur. He was the youngest brother of United States President Richard Nixon. He co-authored his memoir, The Nixons: A Family Portrait, with Karen L. Olson. The book was published in 2009. He was born in Whittier, California. From 1971 until his death, Nixon was the president of Nixon World Enterprises, Inc., an international consulting service based in Washington state.Edward Nixon via Pacific Northwest Center for Global Security Nixon also taught as an assistant professor of naval science at the University of Washington. He was the last surviving member of the five Nixon brothers. Nixon died on February 27, 2019 at the age of 88, at a nursing facility, in Bothell, Washington.Edward Nixon, brother of President Nixon, dies at 88 ==References== ==Other websites== *Nixon Fun Facts via Nixon Foundation Category:1930 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American historians Category:American autobiographers Category:Richard Nixon Category:Businesspeople from California Category:Writers from California
